reviewText:
Early Access Review

sZone is only a shell of a game, has been for years. Huge potential, but development is sloppy and slow. Badly optimized, but even on high settings graphics are somewhat a joke. Mind you, I don't care much for graphics, but this is to inform people, after all. The content that's there feels unpolished, and a constant feel of amateurism washes over you while playing.

However, if you run around the game with this feeling, like I did, you will also often be surprised by the many different angles the game offers. There is plenty to do, you can put hundreds of hours into the game and still see new things the next hour. Eventually the feeling of amateurism would remain, but added with a feeling of that these devs know what they want, and what they want is proper"
recommended:
but also that the road there will be long and hard.

--------

Overall it's only barely a MMORPG in the traditional sense

reviewerDisplayName: 𝕭 𝖗 𝖆 𝖙 𝖙 𝖞
reviewText:
Early Access Review

Free to play, Good idea, Cool visuals.
And way too early, but if it stays free to play it's going to be worth it. I can't say how good the for-pay addons make it, because I'm not spending the money on them! I normally do this if I feel a game is really really good to begin with. That being said, sZone-Online definitely isn't bad.

Play Style

Did you ever play Anarchy Online? The engine and play style is a LOT like Anarchy Online. I felt pretty at home with it, but the whole thing feels like it just moves way too slow. I do like the way the weapons work, and the crafting system, but it seems like there's way too much to do in a game that should have faster pacing. I'm going to check back with it later, but right now it's a little too young to make a good judgment about the quality of it.

Sound

Mute it, listen to your own music. Sound is the only thing that I can say really detracts from it. If they were to increase the actual game speed by about 50% and get some better sounds (particularly for the voice actors, the levels are all over the place for EVERYTHING.) It would definitely bump up the quality.

Overall.

I'll play it again in a few months. For a free to play title, it's really not that bad. It works pretty well, navigation is a bit difficult, but that's true of any new MMORPG. I have to hand it to them for not doing a copy of Blizzard's MMO engine. It's nothing like that, and I really liked the Anarchy Online system so it's a nice thing to play around with again. SUPER similar to that.

Right now I'm giving it a 6.5/10 - Check it out, but it's still too young to really put a ton of time into.

10/10:Would OD again.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSzone_Online данный проект единственный в своём роде.Открытый мир,где можно делать всё что угодно! Ранее я не встречал такие проекты,да может тут не всё гладко,но администрация пытается сделать всё,чтобы данная игра была лучше,и вызывала интерес среди игроков,Играть в неё одно удовольствие,большой выбор как прокачать своего персонажа,интересный пвп,пве режим,борьба против мобов,которых обитает в зоне приличное количество,разновидность мобов зашкаливает. Вражда между кланами,постоянные войны!Огромный выбор оружия и экипировки,Вид от 1 и 3 лица. Большое количество локаций,Также тут присутствуют аномалии в которых рождаются артефакты.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you are looking for a MMORPG Game that has a STALKER flavour in it you made it! sZone Online is a good, solid game for all STALKER fans! With many maps, many weapons and items to choose and a PvP Arena to fight other stalkers this game will give you many hours of fun! For a Free To Play Game it's excellent! I definitely recommend this to all STALKER fans and post-apocalyptic fans that want to try a new game. sZone Online has excellent graphics, very good gameplay and many ways to play it! Definitely a must try!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis has been one of the most annoying games I've tried to deal with. date: you need something more than a plain crosshair when you're trying to "aim". I shouldn't have to buy a scop to be able to stick the gun up to my face and use the ironsights. reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game crashed at first, even the second time I tried. The third time my antivirus deleted a DLL  and suddenly the game started.
Lets begin with the positive things: This game has potential as a free to play game, nice layout, everything works fine without lagging and the UI is easy to understand... Ones you get your first weapon you are ready to kill some monsters or jump in a pvp match. Its an apocaliptic world so you need to find your way.
Things I didnt like much was the russian language, and where there can be found a translation, its really bad, with all respect for our Russian comrades, I dont understand a word of Russian, it would certainly improve the game if there would be a full english version or a better translation. The radio station in the background is broadcasting in Russian as well. The controls can be a little clunky, but nothing to spoil the fun. The pvp is very unbalanced so work in pve to get some good stuff and prepare to defend your staton.
6.5/10 (Enough room to improve)

reviewText:
Geniales Spiel , besonders für die Fans der Stalker Reihe .

Habe selten ein Spiel mit so einer guten Atmosphäre gespielt besonders im Online Bereich.
Es ist extrem herrausfordernd . sowas hab ich bei neueren Spielen selten noch erlebt. Kein Fehler wird einem verziehen.
Also macht euch darauf gefasst das ihr öfter die Bodentexturen begutachten könnt :D

Klar das Spiel hat seine Fehler , hatte STALKER auch , aber besonders für Fans dieser Spielereihe bietet es einen ungewöhnlichen Wiedererkennungswert.

Gebt nichts auf die Kommentare bei Steam die sind in jedem Fall sowieso keine Referenz. Ist halt nichts für Casual Player.

Probiert es aus und macht euch euer eigenes Bild .

Pro :

Einzigartige Spielwelt
Komplexes Craftingsystem
viele Waffen
sehr viele Quests (ohne Questfinder in den meisten Fällen)
Sehr nette Community (wenn auch meistens russisch)

Con:

Einige Bugs
Teure Clan Basen ( die man aber nicht braucht)
manchmal Performance Probleme

Ich hoffe ich konnte euch mit diesem Deutschen Review weiterhelfen .
Man sieht sich in der Zone :)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPlayed the game for as long as humanly possible I swear. Not only is the game a catastrophic buggy mess with more broken english then my friend, who, by the way, talks like he has peanut butter stuck to the top of his mouth, the game also exhibits a brutal learning curve in the beginning. I am thrown into Lubech station, a cesspit for all the wanna be stalkers trying to reminesce about an old game gone. After randomly talking to old sweaty russian dudes, I am awarded a ak-47 and a pistol. Oh and the pistol comes with no ammo... So after grinding out quests and dieing countless times, I get to a part where I am supposed to retrieve reports from different scout towers. I get to the first tower, my spawn point changes, and I am mauled by dogs for 25 minutes. This game is almost as bad as the anal prolapse I got on my fourteenth birthday. Honestly, you'd be better of playing Puzzle Pirates or  Roblox than this aborted fetus of a game.

reviewText:
This has to be one of the most abysmal games ive ever seen, played for a few minutes before realizing how incredibly awful this game was.

Couldnt reload my ak even though i had ammo for it.

couldnt equip a jacket i got at lvl 1 because my skill was too low, not sure what skill you would need to put on a jacket other then maybe, some arms.

Went to shoot some rats, aiming system is absolutely horrendous and so is movement.

Interact key is F but tried pressing the F key on an npc i was supposed to talk to but for some reason the npc wouldnt talk to me at all.

Tried re-configuring the keys but still nothing, npc's can not be spoken to.

All in all i would say that out of all the zombie/post apocalyptic games......ever made, this is absolutely one of the worst games ever created by human kind.

Avoid this at all times

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm speechless for what I just played. It seems like it has potential... but it just isn't a good game.
The graphics are terrible, which I'm fine with. I can get over graphics very easily. However, even with the lowest setting, the most fps I could get out of the game was 18, making it pretty unplayable.

I got to lvl 2 by shooting mutant dogs, and then my gun jammed, jammed again, jammed again, and then I died. The game also lacks any kind of instructions on what you're supposed to do. Me and many other players spent 10+ minutes just figuring out how to get a gun, and then it took a while to even get the gun working.

You have to talk by a guy at your spawn, who says he'll give you a gun at lv 3 (which is impossible to get to without a gun) and that you need to bring him a stick. So you walk to the middle of the building, talk to another guy, gives you a gun to finish the last quest. After you get that, don't equip the ak or the pistol. Sell the pistol and the buckshot ammo, and then you have to drag the magazine onto the gun, then equip the gun, then right click the ammo for the ak, then you have to load the ammo. And now you can reload.

It seems like an outdated fps, that requires an expensive computer just to run.
For now, i'll stick to things like firefall for fps mmo's.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's clunky, it feels very dated in both graphics and game play. Doesn't help that the English translation reads like it was done with an online translator. Quest objectives are hard to follow and figure out, partially because of the bad translation, and partially just by bad design.

I could only tolerate it for 30 minutes before I gave up. If a game can't grab me in that amount of time it's just not going to be fun for me. Your mileage, as always, will vary.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

COPY AND PASTE IF YOU THINK THE SAME!!!
Dear devs, here is a list to get more people into this game:
interface: show the damage done to a player or enemy in a rpg style (a number above the enemy
show exp gained and items picked somewhere else instead in the chat
leave the chat box for chat
gameplay: reallistic damage, less ammo, more expensive ammo to compensate the damage of the bullets
better ai for animals (animals wander around in many other places, they attack weaker animals, and DON'T CAMP PLAYERS BODIES AFTER KILLING THEM IF THE PLAYER DECIDES TO REST)
patrolling npcs from factions that shoot anyone with low reputation with them
anomalies damage animals and npcs
ACTUAL Crafting
animations: better animations for running, throwing, recoil, jumping, switching guns, crouch aimming and crouch in general
fps animations and stutter-ish running animation fix
servers: maybe a british server or american server? too much ping so far
THE GAME HAS POTENTIAL IF YOU LISTEN TO THE COMUNITY, i WOULDN'T hate the game YET, i'll be giving it a year,cheers...

reviewText:
sZone-Online is an MMO based on
S.T.A.L.K.E.R. with things such as artifacts and the gloominess of the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. universe.

Pros: Free
Gloomy environment
Cons: Low FPS on most likely a large variety of rigs even with graphics that should be able to be ran at 60 (25-30 and I'm able to run Arma 3 at ultra at 35-50)

Graphics aren't too different from the original S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series even though the MMO should be a revival

I disliked the game strongly and didn't want to continue over an hour and uninstalled.

I would suggest the Metro series as it has a linear plot (if any are interested), more action, better graphics and more.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

for start i don't know what i don't now what to say even...
game does not look so amazing as many people want good looking game, it's not for those players for sure.
it haves still some things what have not be turned into english as game use to be all russian but does not bother me.
but first thing what i came up with was that i run out of ammo all the time because all you need is working gun and ammo.
you can get ammo from missions, turn artifacts into ammo or buy it but i find ammo as really expensive thing to buy.

i have not played stalker games before but i have seen some and for huge fans, this might be disapointing game.
there is small hope anyway in this game because of the mood inside it, of course it might be sometimes boring at start.

but here comes my own opinion, i don't like crafting options at all... it's kinda simple just spend xp into skill points and with skill points you will unlock skill but... it somehow feels really stupid at same time when you could just use xp to unlock skill just like basic skills can be done. i have not really discovered any crafting options yet even, it took long enough even be able repair your gun by yourself (what sucks at lvl 1 repair) it's much cheaper to repair gun in shop.

i have played another MMORPG game called as FallenEarth and i have to say it's much better but there is always good and bad sides in games likes these. i don't really understand many things still in this game when instead in fallenearth you get better info for missions for example. best thing anyway in fallenearth is that crafting is made really simple by just giving you recipes and you look if you got all items needed. but fallenearth is much more boring because it does not have mood inside it expect in some special" places.

i do have to say anyway honestly that i kinda like SZone even it maybe sucks sometimes or all the time for other people.
you better just try it out by yourself and then tell your own opinion

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPlayed for 6 hours. Ran out of ammo 3 times then money 2 times buying ammo. Died to animals because I have no ammo. What kind of a Post apocalyptic game doesn't have melee weapons? I spend most of my time unconcious because I don't have the money to buy more ammo. But I did all my missions. Turns out they don't payout enough for you to buy ammo, let alone one piece of armor. Found a 'special' items vendor. Turned out you can buy all the gear, ammo, and meds you want with GP (which is currency bought with actual cash) Conclusion: Yet another Free to PLay Pay to Win game. I highly recommend this pos!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPlayed this game with my friend. It seemed promising at first, but it's really not. It's just a complete fail. Majority of the people who play this game speak another language, I believe it was probably Russian? Even though my friend and I were both on the NA Server, not the European one. Quests are completely broken in this game. It has a tag of Open World
date: although to get around, you have to walk alongside walls for a couple minutes, to get to the other side, which was disappointing. The mobs in this game are terrible. Suddenly my friend and I were attacked by three giant spiders, and immediately died. We had the choice to either wait and respawn in that exact place and die again, or go back to spawn, which wasn't that far from there, you would only have to walk along the wall to get around. Also, played this game on max settings, graphics were still terrible, I'm pretty sure DayZ has better graphics on the lowest settings possible than this. If you want a real Open World
recommended: apocalyptic type of game, I recommend DayZ or H1Z1, whichever suits your taste.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you'r a fan of STALKER, this is most definitely for you. The controls are a little stiff, the graphics are a little lackluster, there's a mistranslation here or there, but there's still plenty of junk to explore. They throw gear at you, there's plenty of lore, the devs obviously care about their fans if they're running this Free after all of the trouble they went through to get it running. If you get stuck trying to authorize, just back out and retry it.


Treat this game like wine, it just needs a little bit of time.

reviewText: This game looked cool, but it was a dissapointment. To start, the game lagged even when I put the graphics at the bare minimum and it looked like it could have bean on the origional Xbox. I know graphics are not everything, and if the game was amazing and it ran decently I would have let it slide. Next, the game didn't give you a very clear tutorial, forcing you to guess what did what and a quest system that gave you little to no detail about what to do. Finaly, it was origionaly made in I beleive Russian. That wouldn't be a problem if they didn't have as many grammatical errors and some dialouge that is in Russian. Even after all of that, I would still try it since its free. Just don't get your hopes up.

reviewText:
If you want a game where you have no idea what the hell to do, then this game is definitely for you. If you want a game where you actually know where you're going in life, don't bother.
Apart from the lack of tuition this game provides, there are many other downsides including:
- Poor graphics
- Poor sound effects
- Poor introduction
- Poor gunplay

The only thing this game has going for it is the potential to throw rocks at NPC's and have them tell you that you were not whipped enough as a child. As well as this, I seemed to uninstall it without any problems.

Warning: If you install this game, please go to your local doctors to check for AIDs. You have been warned.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game seems pretty terrible TBH. As of right now it's trying to be S.T.A.L.K.E.R. while being worse than Stalker. A lot of it is borderline copyright-infringing, which I would instantly forgive if this game was a worthy followup to the Stalker series. It is not. The graphics are dated (Worse than Call of Pripyat's), the gunplay is dated (worse than Call of Pripyat's), the conversation interface is terrible (worse than... you get where I'm going).

If you wanna get into the whole post-apocalpytic scavenger vibe, play S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat. If you've played that before, maybe install a new mod you've never tried before (Misery is quite popular, but there are some other names I've not investigated yet).

The game is Early Access, but the way it looks now would have to be nearly completely overhauled... every single graphic texture, for example. I may try sZone again AFTER it leaves EA.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is not terrible for being an early access game, but there is a lot of problems i've noticed with the little time that I spent playing it. The whole combat style in itself is a bit awkward, because the mutants move really weird. When you try to pick up items it lags a bit, and the character movement could use some improvement. Quests don't give you that much information so you're left running around a vacant land with funky mutants trying to kill you, not knowing what the objective is. If the game developers decided to carry on with this game I can see some potential with some updates and overall improvement of mechanics. It's one of those games where you try really hard to get into, but the little issues just make it difficult. So in the games current state, I do not reccomend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game seems pretty terrible TBH. As of right now it's trying to be S.T.A.L.K.E.R. while being worse than Stalker. A lot of it is borderline copyright-infringing, which I would instantly forgive if this game was a worthy followup to the Stalker series. It is not. The graphics are dated (Worse than Call of Pripyat's), the gunplay is dated (worse than Call of Pripyat's), the conversation interface is terrible (worse than... you get where I'm going).

If you wanna get into the whole post-apocalpytic scavenger vibe, play S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat. If you've played that before, maybe install a new mod you've never tried before (Misery is quite popular, but there are some other names I've not investigated yet).

The game is Early Access, but the way it looks now would have to be nearly completely overhauled... every single graphic texture, for example. I may try sZone again AFTER it leaves EA.

Review:
Vet S.T.A.L.K.E.R./Survarium/DayZ/Rust/The Forest/genre player: Only play this if you want old school semi-bugged stalker gameplay but multiplayer-semiMMO style. Its harsh and unpolished but 99% of the time its the player that suck trying todo too much 2 soon in the giant harsh world. Its quite common to find new monsters or atmospheric locations only to enter the death spiral trying not to giveup your new fancy loot. I'm still persisting thought the mediocra grapichs and bugs but I also persisted game breaking bugs in STALKER saving often and loading back to earlier stages.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL:DR: at the end as well as EDITs about my experience playing this. Starts off as a recommended game and moves towards the opposite.

I would say this game is a diamond in the rough but its not exactly a diamond. Its really rough around the edges and its clunky. But its enjoyable and captures some of the STALKER/Metro vibe that I personally have been looking for. I played this game back before it was added to steam I have made a total of 4 characters in my time and each time I ended up abandoning them because I had no idea what to do until recently when I found a clan. FIND A CLAN it will make your life easier and you will enjoy the game with the help.

Lets start with the veggies first:
Okay english translations - its more or less accurate to what you actually have to do but the dialog is laughable sometimes.
Large RU population - I play on the NA server and I would say about half of the population doesnt speak english.
Clunky combat and movement - you can move past it once you get used to it but it can be annoying at first.
Poorly optomized - Im running a hex core i7 and a 660 ti and on medium settings I get 70 fps with drops to 30 fps and when memory leaks happen which they happen a lot I get forced to sit around 20-30 frams. But a simple relaunch fixes it.
Not Graphically impressive - not much to say here.
Not Newbie Friendly - The game can be hard to understand and doesnt do a good job of pointing you in the right direction. Dont epext it to theme park you like WoW. A lot of players, myself included, didnt have an idea what to do when they hit the first big zone.

On to the desert:
Interesting PvP system - There is a flagging system in the game so its managable to not have to worry about other players. But there are areas that flag you/force you into pvp which you need to watch out for. There is a wealth system that means if you collect enough value on your person whether its in ammo, mutant parts, artifacts, or junk you eventually are forced to flag. Thankfully when you die you can get back up or spawn back to a safe zone. Going to the same zone has a change to drop some of your loot. But never your guns/armor.
Vibe - It has that STALKER/Metro vibe where the world is dangerous and even in high end armor the world is a dangerous place. No dying is not linked to your gear or level but the gear can come in handy. It mostly comes from experience. Much like it is supposed to in the STALKER series.




Why would I suggest this game to anyone? Because its a small download and its free. And due to the atmostphere I would suggest any Metro or STALKER player out there at least give it a try.

TL;DR: Its clunky, tough, russian, and sometimes downright frustrating. But its fun, free, small to download, and it scratches that STALKER itch. If you give a try hit up the steam forums to see if you can find a clan to join. It helps a lot.


EDIT 7/22/2015 : also, you are basically screwed if you ever need support. So far half the responses for my support tickets in the english support area have been in russian. One ticket has been in for almost a week now and the other for a day or two. They give a response very quickly but actually solving the problem they seem to be inadept at. So god help you if you need support

EDIT 7/29/2015 : Recently they added the ability to buy weapons for real cash in the cash shop in this game. But not just any weapons, weapons that are pretty hard to get ahold of and not just for any price. They are selling them right now for $80 god damn dollars. USD of course. Now that the game has offically stepped into a blatant pay to win moment with high tier PVP armor and the best guns in the game being buyable without any work. I cant recomment this game. Only bother playing this game if you are really craving a STALKER MMO and you can suffer through it massive faults. As of writing this edit I am done with this game. Its a P2W game that runs like ♥♥♥, the NA server is unstable, and over half the NA player base is russian while most players dont even speak english.

reviewText: I am very disappointed in how small the mobs are. I find myself having to couch constantly to aim for the hitboxes. In addition to them being small, they seem to amubush you easier. I died constantly, and lost a lot of my ammo. You can't survive without a gun, even though they offer you the option to 'throw a stone,' which I thought would be quick and an 'oh ♥♥♥♥ my gun it jammed and I need to kill this before I die and have to wait an annoying 30 seconds.' Well I don't know if you know, but hitting a small mob with a rock, and you have to aim for this incredibly fast mob .. it isn't fun.\nBut let's stop talking about how annoying it is to hit mobs. You know what's even more annoying? Earning enough money to buy one clip of ammo. And you run out so fast, even by conserving ammo by firing one shot at a time. Especially for the amount of quests you get that requires you to kill MORE stuff.\nIn summary, combat sucks, quests are dull, nothing exciting happens in this game except for getting a roll of toliet paper from a quest and haven't no ♥♥♥♥ing idea what it's used for.

I cannot recommend this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was very curious about this game and for .99 cents I'd say it's worth buying. The first thing you will notice is most everything is in Russian which can be very confusing at first but for me it meant having to talk to an NPC then having to re-talk to them to get the English text. It was not hard to figure out. I made a friend basically right when I started the game up. We figured out how to group up and started questing together. The games provides many laughs in a mostly dreary and depressing world.
Before I knew it I was killing bald rats and decapitating mutant puppy dog heads. The quests for the most part seem a bit Fetchy" at times but is still very early in gameplay. I am interested to see what type of end-game content sZone has.(I am only level 5 as of writing) The arena is hard as nails but still has some intrigue. I mostly joined to get insta-killed by some Russian dude.
The world is mostly open with some invisible walls here and there. The graphics aren't anything to write home about but the fun in the gameplay defintely is there. Nothing bad considering it's in early access. If you are Russian
recommended:
or post-apocalyptic themed games I'd say snatch this game up.

Killed numerous Rats and Mutated Puppy Dogs with an AK-47  - 10/10

-Casey"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At first I was scared to try it, but in fact, I discovered an amaizing video game. It is possible to interact with the world in such a maner, that you quickly realise EVERYTHING is possible. Just some exemples so you can see what I'm talking about (of course, I recommend you try it yourself so can like, enjoy one of the best experiences I had in my ENTIRE LIFE).

In this game you can: feel lost because you don't speak russian, kill rats, become a druid (I'm not kidding, a DRUID), you can shoot weapons, and jump out of towers. Should I specify you sometimes have to jump 2 times to kill yourself... and many many more actions...

Don't take this  review like a funny one, go and try the game yourself and experience the best HOW DO I GET THIS AK47 TO WORK" simulation

reviewText:
Early Access Review

You can read this review, but, as is the case with all reviews, it is laced with opinion. I have compressed an hour’s gameplay into this five minute highlight first-impressions video if you want to see what it is like. Or you can read the review below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c8r0pa-iy-c&feature=youtu.be

This game is to Stalker: Shadow of Chernobyl, what Elder Scrolls Online was to Skyrim; an interesting idea with some graphical scale-back.  The general feel of gameplay is affected by the fact that a Single Player FPS (the original Stalker) has been turned into a Multiplayer TPS. That being said, the environments are atmospheric, look good and are open to exploration. Not so sure about the animations however, which currently look clunky and are incomplete. The sound also requires work but can sometimes make you jump.

There does not seem to be any PVP survival element yet although there is a H2O counter among other survival based indicators on the dash. It is difficult to say anything conclusive regarding the game's mechanics however as all of the text-based instruction is in Russian.

I'm giving it a thumbs up, not based on its current state but on what it might one day become. It is actually quite playable but at the same time is clunky and incomplete. However, compare this game to Day Z, which has been in Early Access for years and is still trying to get its base-zombies to work properly while its staff censor negative comments on its forums, this game is a gem. It is functional, offers varying encounters, and the devs seem really friendly and eager to receive feedback. I’m personally very interested to see where sZone will go.

Well I don't know what to say about this crap game so here is a tutorial on how to make pancakes.

Step 1:
Whisk 1 1/2 cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon baking soda in a medium bowl.

Step 2:
Whisk 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons milk, 4 tablespoons melted butter and 1 egg in a separate bowl; fold into the flour mixture until just combined (it's OK if there are some lumps).

Step 3:
Brush a large nonstick skillet or griddle with butter and heat over medium-low heat. Add 1/4 cupfuls of batter and cook until bubbly on top and golden on the bottom, about 4 minutes. Flip and cook until golden on the bottom, about 2 more minutes. (Makes 6 to 8 pancakes.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you can get past how old it looks and feels....it's pretty good

Now I wont be unrealistic and say that is amazing. By no means is it amazing.
The thing I want to push is that it is playable and not in the whole I guess I can play this for awhile" way.
This game is fun to play because it is a nice FPS MMORPG to take a break with. It's nice and relaxed and explores the already awesome S.T.A.L.K.E.R world.
The class system is pretty neat and there is a lot of unique items and enemies.
The missions are your typical MMO style missions. Go kill this and go collect this and go talk to this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and and and......it never ends.
If I had this in the early 2000s it would have blown my balls off.
It is a really fun game to just casually play.
I haven't really experienced any flaws other than....it's old.
Oh and everyone is Russian. I am fine with Russians but....I don't know the language.
All in All I say give it a try. It's free.
But hey

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A multiplayer version of S.T.A.L.K.E.R., but with too many issues right now.  This is also an Early Access review.

Graphics: The graphcis look very dated, with an almost ps2 quality.  The world and character models look decent, but close inspection shows issues.  The character models also feel stiff and have odd animations.  There is (at least for me) some pop-in with distant models.  The game LOOKS decent, but that's it.

Sound: Sound is what makes good atmosphere, gives tension and excitment.  This game does not have that.  Sure, you hear random Russian dialouge around from PCs, gunshots and monster grunts.  But there is really nothing there to affect you audiowise.  The orginal S.T.A.L.K.E.R. had sounds that made you scared and frightened at what was stocking you; or scared you indoors when a Psi Storm came up.  Not once did I feel scared of threatened being outside.  The sound is pretty lame.

Control:  The keyboard/mouse controls are mostly competant, but very sluggish at times.

Gameplay:  The main issue of this game.  Being that the game is still about 40%-60% Russian, so it can be hard to find certain characters for quests since they're names are still in Russian, while the quest log gives your the English names.  The quests are mostly" in english
date: though I have come across some still untranslated.  Same goes for some items.  Leveing up is also tedious
recommended: as it takes a while to reach the next level
hoursPlayed: and there is really no explanation on how to select skills.  It took me an hopur to figure out how that system worked.  Money is also difficult to come by
voteText: which is frustrating because you ALWAYS need ammo and ammo isn't cheap; and as far as I have seen
helpfulPercent: there is NO melee weapons.  But the biggest issue is the lag.  Everytime I have played
votesHelpful: my ping was usuallly no less than 240!  This is bad for a shooter
votesTotal: as you could take damage from something you don't even see yet
votesFunny: or keep taking damage from something you killed seconds earlier!  You will also waste ammo shooting at things that have long since moved.  The lag sometimes even makes the gameplay unbearable.\n\nAs it stands now
commentsCount: I CANNOT reccomend this game.  Not without it's issues being fixed and the lag improved as best it can.  Hopefully in the future

Unfortunately it didn't loop so i ended up going back into the que and instantly leaving just to restart the music once more. I didnt have to play the game to know that i had won. What could this game possibly offer me that can top what it had already delivered upon entering.

10/10 Would Win Again
